title: Ian Massey
text:
Ian Robert Massey (born 10 September 1985) is an English <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er. Massey is a right-handed <a href="Batsman%20%28cricket%29">batsman</a> who bowls right-arm <a href="off%20break">off break</a>. He was born in <a href="Hereford">Hereford</a>, <a href="Herefordshire">Herefordshire</a> and educated at <a href="Shrewsbury%20School">Shrewsbury School</a>.
While studying for his degree at <a href="Queens%27%20College%2C%20Cambridge">Queens' College, Cambridge</a>, Massey made his <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class</a> debut for <a href="Cambridge%20University%20Centre%20of%20Cricketing%20Excellence">Cambridge UCCE</a> against <a href="Kent%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Kent</a> in 2006. He made four further first-class appearances while at Cambridge, including two appearances for <a href="Cambridge%20University%20Cricket%20Club">Cambridge University</a> against <a href="Oxford%20University%20Cricket%20Club">Oxford University</a> in the <a href="University%20Match%20%28cricket%29">University Match</a>es of 2006 and 2007. In his five first-class matches, he scored 253 runs at an <a href="batting%20average%20%28cricket%29">average</a> of 28.11, with a high score of 65. His highest score, which was his only first-class <a href="half%20century">fifty</a>, came against Oxford University in 2007.
In 2006, he made a single <a href="Minor%20Counties%20Championship">Minor Counties Championship</a> appearance for <a href="Herefordshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Herefordshire</a> against <a href="Cornwall%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Cornwall</a>.
